issue.title: Manage different projects with one entry point
issue.body:
Hi! We're have different independent integration processes developed by different teams. What we'd like to have is centralized ability to run and schedule pipelines from these projects. 

As I see according to current architecture there is only way to manage multiple pipelines from one project at one entry point (=http port) so there are two possible ways to manage our processes:
1. host each independent project on different ports and somehow route to desired one (this is not very convenient cause you should either know project name to type it in address bar manually or write own web page to route to these projects)
2. mix all processes in one project and manage only pipelines (this is not very good cause different teams should use one repository and project once will became like big garbage dump)

I see a possible minimal solution as simple ability to switch project using dropdown list at top level breadcrumb. This can be done by simply get all projects from specified folder while starting management frontend

comment.body: Hey @kreopt , you can check the "workspace management" feature: https://docs.mage.ai/production/developing-in-the-cloud/workspaces/overview

I see a possible minimal solution as simple ability to switch project using dropdown list at top level breadcrumb. This can be done by simply get all projects from specified folder while starting management frontend

pull_request.title: [jk] Detach block from shared pipelines
pull_request.body:
# Description
- Add block "Detach" feature, which lets user duplicate a block and remove any associations with other pipelines (would require to choose a new, unique block name). Feature is visible for blocks with shared pipelines.
- Supported for python, sql, R, and data integration YAML blocks (not supported for dbt blocks).

# How Has This Been Tested?
With add-on blocks (conditional and callback) and upstrea/downstream dependencies:
![detach block with PUT](https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/78053898/76a6c266-b354-4777-bcf1-1da00028dd56)

Dep graph before detaching `custom_sql_block2_c2`:
![image](https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/78053898/c15501ea-7b68-4697-a040-ef369a8509c1)
Dep graph after detaching `custom_sql_block2_c2` (replaced with `custom_sql_block2_c2_copy`):
![image](https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/78053898/4cf18f56-33ef-4b59-a67a-a2e9b2f9a2c0)

# Checklist
- [X] The PR is tagged with proper labels (bug, enhancement, feature, documentation)
- [X] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have added unit tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [x] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation

@@ -2861,16 +2866,39 @@ def __update_name(self, name) -> None:
             parent_dir = os.path.dirname(new_file_path)
             os.makedirs(parent_dir, exist_ok=True)
 
-            os.rename(old_file_path, new_file_path)
+            if detach:
+                """"
+                Detaching a block creates a copy of the block file while keeping the existing block
+                file the same. Without detaching a block, the existing block file is simply renamed.
+                """
+                with open(new_file_path, 'w') as f:
+                    f.write(self.content)

pull_request.title: [ac] Make sure file browser context menu is always fully visible in the viewport when open
pull_request.body:
# Description

Previously, the file browser context menu would be partially hidden in scenarios where the file browser area was too small to fit the full menu. This was because overflow was hidden in the file browser aside:

https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/8130751/91073d14-39f7-4688-ad97-5e4ca81990c5

This PR fixes this bug and makes sure that the file browser context menu is always fully visible within the viewport ([Airtable Task Pt. 1](https://airtable.com/applEuqJsK4zF5yJK/tbl5bIlFkk2KhCpL4/viwCmaGgcnwD9IqOM/recrnz90jwBp3lxJJ?blocks=hide)). The fix makes use of [React Portals](https://react.dev/reference/react-dom/createPortal) to render the context menu into a DOM node that exists outside the DOM hierarchy of the parent component, which has `overflow: hidden`.

Note: This is a one-off fix that works because the menu uses fixed positioning; the longer term solution would be a much bigger refactor to `FlyoutMenu` (potentially using React Portals while supporting absolute positioning).

# How Has This Been Tested?

- [x] Tested that the file browser context menu is fully visible when aside has a narrow width
- [x] Tested that the file browser context menu is fully visible when clicking a file near the bottom of the viewport
- [x] Tested that the above behavior works for the file, block file, and folder context menus

https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/8130751/f198e126-fae5-43b7-967b-22cc4f631133

cc: @johnson-mage

issue.title: [ac] Add `ctrl/cmd + click` keyboard shortcut for selecting pipeline run rows
issue.body:
# Description

In the Pipeline Runs table, you can click on a row to **highlight** it and open the sidekick with run details. You can also click on a row's checkbox (on the far left) to **select/deselect** it for performing actions on one or more rows. Previously, clicking on a row's checkbox both selected/deselected and highlighted the row.

This PR makes a few updates to how we highlight/select rows:
* When you click on a row's checkbox, we no longer highlight the row and only select/deselect it. We've also made a broader change to prevent a table row from being highlighted if the user clicked on an interactive element (e.g. `a`, `button`, `input`) in the row.
* We also add a new keyboard shortcut for selecting rows. If you hold the meta key (`Cmd` on Mac or `Ctrl` on Windows) and click on an unselected row, that row will be selected without being highlighted. If the clicked row is already selected, that row will be unselected. ([Airtable task](https://airtable.com/applEuqJsK4zF5yJK/tbl5bIlFkk2KhCpL4/viwCmaGgcnwD9IqOM/rectr4unRQGOn8xjz?blocks=hide))
* The new keyboard shortcut only works when rows are selectable in the Pipeline Runs table. If rows are not selectable (e.g. on the Backfills page), the keyboard shortcut does not take effect. For example, if you hold the meta key + click a row in the Pipeline Runs table on the Backfills page, the row will be highlighted.

# How Has This Been Tested?

- [x] Tested that clicking on a row's checkbox selects/deselects it without highlighting it
- [x] Tested that clicking on a row highlights it (but does not select/unselect it)
- [x] Tested that clicking on an unselected row while holding the meta key down selects it without highlighting it
- [x] Tested that clicking on a selected row while holding the meta key down deselects it without highlighting it
- [x] Tested that clicking on an interactive element in the row doesn't highlight the row

https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/8130751/436fca61-796c-4959-ae5b-cfc3385b483c

cc: @johnson-mage

comment.body: > I ended up going with the `meta key + click` rather than `shift key + click` shortcut for the following reasons: > > * The former feels more intuitive for selecting individual rows and follows the same keyboard selection behavior as in file browsers. Shift + click is typically used for selecting multiple consecutive rows in one click. > * Shift + click also triggers the default text selection behavior for browsers, which we could handle if we also wanted to add that shortcut and override the default selection behavior. > I agree with this decision.

pull_request.title: [ac] Improve app header styling
pull_request.body: # Description Kai and I were chatting about how the shared app header had inconsistent styling (e.g. button sizing, item placements): ![original_header](https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/8130751/ba5bd307-6e6b-48b8-a57f-f7ab4037dc20) So we came up with a couple minor styling improvements! * Re-ordered the items on the right side of the app header: Github actions button, current time display, version display, version update button, Live Chat button * Standardized the Github actions button, current time display, and version display to be 12px Fira codemonospace * Standardized the version update button and Live Chat button to be 14px Roboto * Made the button styling more minimalistic + cleaner and shortened the version update button text * Hovering over the Github actions button shows the full branch name * Hovering over the version update button shows a more descriptive action: "Update version to ``" # How Has This Been Tested? https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/8130751/5a6cae48-1866-44cb-b315-415f83cfa2ad cc: @johnson-mage

issue.title: File browser context menu is cut off
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
- File browser context menu is cut off when right-clicking towards bottom of window.
- Need to position file browser context menu within viewport (e.g. if the context menu is opened at the bottom of the window) so that it is not cut off.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to `/files` endpoint or any pipeline's "Edit" page.
2. Expand folders so there is a folder/file at the very bottom of the window (shrink window height if necessary).
3. Right-click one of the last items at the bottom of the window.
4. Context menu should be cut off.

**Expected behavior**
Context menu should not be cut off (e.g. should appear above the cursor instead of below it).

**Screenshots**
![file browser context menu bottom of window](https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/78053898/3f0d331a-2ddb-444b-ae20-331d8651f4ad)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: MacOS
 - Browser: Chrome
 - Version: 0.9.36

pull_request.title: [Fix] Reposition file browser context menu
pull_request.body:
# Description
<!-- Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed.
Please also include relevant motivation and context.
List any dependencies that are required for this change.
-->
Moved the menu up whenever it overflows off the screen. Also moved it a bit to the right, for good measure.
Resolves #3800.


# How Has This Been Tested?
<!-- Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes.
Provide instructions so we can reproduce.
-->

- Before

- After
![image](https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/132081506/7e3b101e-5a85-45f4-a85c-99635918d7a3)

- [ ] I have added unit tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works

comment.body:
> Fixed, but what do you think about the change of the `x` position like below? I feel like it'd be a minor UX improvement, but don't want to push the change without getting your opinion.

PR looks good now! Gonna merge it. We actually don't need to adjust the `x` position because we have another PR that will show the file browser context menu above the adjacent container, making repositioning of it on the x-axis unnecessary.

repo.description: 🧙 The modern replacement for Airflow. Build, run, and manage data pipelines for integrating and transforming data.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -2861,16 +2866,39 @@ def __update_name(self, name) -> None:
             parent_dir = os.path.dirname(new_file_path)
             os.makedirs(parent_dir, exist_ok=True)
 
-            os.rename(old_file_path, new_file_path)
+            if detach:
+                """"
+                Detaching a block creates a copy of the block file while keeping the existing block
+                file the same. Without detaching a block, the existing block file is simply renamed.
+                """
+                with open(new_file_path, 'w') as f:
+                    f.write(self.content)
comment.body:
I would suggest you getting the file content before updating the uuid. 
If the file content was not read before, `self.content` will read the file content from the new path with the new uuid.
https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/blob/master/mage_ai/data_preparation/models/block/__init__.py#L360-L361
https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/blob/master/mage_ai/data_preparation/models/block/__init__.py#L527-L531

pull_request.title: [jk] Detach block from shared pipelines
pull_request.body:
# Description
- Add block "Detach" feature, which lets user duplicate a block and remove any associations with other pipelines (would require to choose a new, unique block name). Feature is visible for blocks with shared pipelines.
- Supported for python, sql, R, and data integration YAML blocks (not supported for dbt blocks).

# How Has This Been Tested?
With add-on blocks (conditional and callback) and upstrea/downstream dependencies:
![detach block with PUT](https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/78053898/76a6c266-b354-4777-bcf1-1da00028dd56)

Dep graph before detaching `custom_sql_block2_c2`:
![image](https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/78053898/c15501ea-7b68-4697-a040-ef369a8509c1)
Dep graph after detaching `custom_sql_block2_c2` (replaced with `custom_sql_block2_c2_copy`):
![image](https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/78053898/4cf18f56-33ef-4b59-a67a-a2e9b2f9a2c0)

# Checklist
- [X] The PR is tagged with proper labels (bug, enhancement, feature, documentation)

issue.title: Blocks depending from reduced blocks won't start anymore
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Starting from v0.9.35, all blocks depending from dynamic children with the reduced output flag turned on, won't start even when their starting conditions are all verified.

The bug is not present in v0.9.34 and older.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a standard pipeline with dynamic blocks just like the one described in the [docs](https://docs.mage.ai/design/blocks/dynamic-blocks)
2. Turn on the Reduced Output option for the second block
3. Trigger once the pipeline
4. Watch it getting stuck after the first four blocks (dynamic block + 3 dynamic children), the last block stays in status `initial`

**Expected behavior**
The output of the dynamic children gets reduced and passed to the next block, that gets scheduled correctly accordingly to its dependencies

**Screenshots**
![image](https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/assets/18249872/4b8ae2d5-760c-4e0d-aae6-beca52090ee4)

**Environment**
 - ECS mage instance deployed using the official terraform scripts
- Reproduced on v0.9.35 and v0.9.36

comment.body:
It's fixed in this PR: https://github.com/mage-ai/mage-ai/pull/3847
Will include it in the upcoming version
